meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inchoate.
meanings.sent1: The inchoatenesses of the plan made it difficult to understand.
meanings.sent2: The inchoatenesses of the painting left the artist feeling unsatisfied.
meanings.sent3: The inchoatenesses of the puzzle made it impossible to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a jumble of inchoatenesses, like scattered puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The inchoatenesses of the dream left her feeling confused and disoriented.

meanings.definition: The incompleteness or lack of development of something.
meanings.sent1: The inchoatenesses of the project delayed its completion.
meanings.sent2: The inchoatenesses of the story left the readers wanting more.
meanings.sent3: The inchoatenesses of the recipe resulted in a strange-tasting dish.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were full of inchoatenesses, waiting to be refined and polished.
meanings.sent5: The inchoatenesses of the garden gave it a wild and untamed beauty.
